Hi Todd,

You were right, it was related to NetBeans (or maybe something
el=
se...who knows)

Instead of writing and isolated ant file for compiling the=
 tests as
you suggested I searched for the xml file which contains the outp=
ut of
the test results after running. XML file with the output should look
=
something like this (just in case somebody else steps into the same
error a=
nd need to search for it):

<testsuite errors=3D"xxx" failures=3D"xxx" name=
=3D"xxx" tests=3D"xxx" time=3D"xxx">
   <properties>
      <property/>
   <=
/properties>
   <testcase>...</testcase>
   <testcase>...</testcase>
   <te=
stcase>...</testcase>
</testsuite>

Results on the XML seems to be more acc=
urate and detailed than the
ones I got through NetBeans.

Thanks for your c=
are and advice,

Diego

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bradley, Todd" <todd=
.bradley@...> wrote:
>
> Hi, Diego.  From your description, it sounds to me=
 like the issue is
> related to NetBeans' JUnit test runner.  I've never us=
ed NetBeans, so I
> don't have any specific advice.  Can you try running yo=
ur tests from
> ant, using <junit> and <junit report>?  If that gives the t=
est results
> you're expecting then, that would tell us that it's a NetBean=
s thing.
> Everything you wrote in your email looks fine to me
> 
> 
> Todd=
.

 am using junit-3.8.1

Every TestSuite inherites
> > from a more general class called BaseProba, l=
ikewise 
> > BaseProba extends   
> > AbstractTransactionalDataSourceSpring=
ContextTests
> > 
> > Then later there is general a class called MainTest (=
extends 
> > TestCase) that actually runs the tests. For instance,
> > 
> >=
 public static Test suite() {
> >    TestSuite ret =3D new TestSuite();
> >=

> >    ret.addTestSuite(myTest2.c=
lass);

ct with a DBMS through Hibernate.
> > Hibernate dialect is HSSQL (HyperSoni=
c SQL, a DBMS which 
> > stores its data straight in memory). In addition, =
we also use 
> > Spring to set some beans which are used by the test classe=
s.

> > Basically, this is my environment. If you need further

ormation I do not mind giving you more detail.

>=
